thread.title: Storm Doris warning extended across the Anglia region
thread.title_full: Storm Doris warning extended across the Anglia region | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Storm Doris warning extended across the Anglia region

organizations.name: essex hertfordshire norfolk cambridgeshire suffolk northamptonshire bedfordshire buckinghamshire

text:
The Met Office has extended its amber weather warning for strong winds across most of the Anglia region as Storm Doris sweeps in on Thursday.
An amber warning, which means "be prepared", is rarely issued in the Anglia region.
Areas covered by yellow and amber weather warnings for strong winds on Thursday. Credit: Met Office The Met Office says: "Whilst the strongest winds look to be only short-lived, damage to structures, interruptions to power supplies and widespread disruption to travel networks are likely, with a danger of injury from flying debris. Trees are also likely to be damaged or blown over."
Most of the Anglia region is under amber alert although the risk is lower in southern parts where there is a yellow "be aware" warning in place.
The weather warning is in force from 6am until 8pm on Thursday 23 February 2017.
Read more: Amber Weather Warning for strong winds in the Anglia region Last updated Wed 22 Feb 2017 Read more 2 updates Warning of 80mph winds as Storm Doris sweeps in Weather Storm Doris Weather warning Essex Hertfordshire Norfolk Cambridgeshire Suffolk Northamptonshire Bedfordshire Buckinghamshire Milton Keynes
